description: From Middle English asshen, aisshen, esscen, from Old English æsċen (“made of ashwood”), equivalent to ash +‎ -en (“made or consisting of”). Cognate with Scots aschin, eschin (“ashen”).

adjectives.description: ashen (comparative more ashen, superlative most ashen)

entries.meaning: Made from the wood of the ash-tree.
examples: An ashen bow and quiver of arrows beside.

description: From Middle English asshen, axen (“ash-colored; pale; lifeless”), equivalent to ash +‎ -en (“made or consisting of”).

adjectives.description: ashen (comparative more ashen, superlative most ashen)

examples: A fine, ashen dust hung in the air.
His ashen face belied his claims of good health.

verbs.description: ashen (third-person singular simple present ashens, present participle ashening, simple past and past participle ashened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To turn into ash; make or become ashy
(transitive, intransitive) To make or become pale
